tool.name: Ligate Fasta Sequences
tool.description: with common and custom adapter sequences

param.name: pre_sequence
param.label: Pre-sequence addition
param.help: Enter the sequence of the front adapter

param.name: sequences
param.label: Sequences to ligate
param.help: 1 or more fasta sequences per file is fine. Multiple files will be reduced to a single output file.

param.name: linker_sequence
param.label: Inter-sequence linker
param.help: Enter the sequence used to link multiple your selected sequences together

param.name: post_sequence
param.label: Post-sequence addition
param.help: Enter the sequence of the end adapter

param.label: New fasta identifier for merged sequences
param.name: id

tool.help:
Fasta Ligation ==============
Ligate multiple sequences into a single one, possibly using adapters at each end and linker sequences.
A fasta file and a BED6 file are produced. The fasta file will have your complete sequence, while the BED6 file will have a series of regions indicating where the input fasta sequences lie in the resulting dataset. This can be used in a tool like the graphical DNA digest tool to highlight where your genes are relative to your ligations.
